website_summaries.verdict: The vivofit jr. 2 lets kids earn rewards for each day they log 60 min. or more of activity.
pros: Tracks steps, sleep, and minutes of activity
Bands for smaller children don't adjust in size
cons: Screen is a bit dark to read easily
Syncing can be tricky and time-consuming, which can drain the battery

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: Daily use over the past several months to include a few beach trips... so far holding up great! My 6 year old likes to make the daily activity challenge and even competes for steps through the app with family. It gives a little firework notification when you meet 60 minutes of daily activity. It motivates her to keep active and helps give an idea of if we are being to lazy or not throughout the day. It doesn’t automatically sync with my phone but it’s easy to just push the button and sync that way.
customer_reviews.author: Heather N Saito

customer_reviews.title: Bands are TINY
customer_reviews.text: Giving only 4 stars for 2 reasons: 1) you can’t create negative points (for negative behavior) and 2) the band says for up to age 7....those bands wouldn’t fit a 3 year old - never mind a 7 year old. Fortunately I had the forethought to buy another bigger band, and we are having to use that one. Can’t use the ones that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cant

customer_reviews.title: Challenging to get it on a petite child’s wrist. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Barely can see the screen. It’s so small. I had only linked once to my phone since this when I have tried to link it again it says the site is down . Highly disappointed. Any child that wears this must have a very small wrist. It was a struggle for her to get it over her hand with my assistance . It was loose enough on her wrist once it was on. I told her I wanted to return it . She said she would rather wear it on her wrist and not be able to do anything with it then struggle to take it off. ( no exaggeration from me or her)
customer_reviews.author: K T

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: My son has had his for 2 years and we have had to change the battery once. The fit is perfect for 6/7 year old. The bands do fade or or peel after time. My two kids love tracking their steps and activities for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Grant T. Thimsen

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 7 year old love these. They love to crack their steps and watch as their goals get closer. I am impressed by the sleep tracking. That was not in my radar until I could start to see patterns in behavior related to sleep. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: richard Waider

customer_reviews.title: Lost time
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her vivofit Jr. She had one for over a year and it stopped working, so we replaced it with this one and it worked good. There were few issues we couldn't get the Minnie or Mickey mouse icon to load on the screen and then after about a month the watch actually started losing time? I contacted Amazon and they contacted the seller and they are sending me a new and a label for me to return the old one, with no difficulties!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 9 and loves this watch! We don’t believe the sleep is super accurate but otherwise we love it! Both of my kids have one and I’d buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Dana W.

customer_reviews.title: Button broke after swimming, watch still works
customer_reviews.text: For the first week this watch worked great. Then we went swimming. It says it’s waterproof and it did not affect the inner memory. But it did affect the button. It wouldn’t push at all. My 4 year old was so annoyed and frustrated that she couldn’t use her watch because the button didn’t work. Eventually it was pushed so hard the button came off and now her fingers are small enough that she can push this little inner button. The watch works fine but isn’t as pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Karly Kleiner

customer_reviews.title: Ours died after just 2.5 months! Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in late March as a birthday gift for my daughter. It died last week, meaning it didn’t even last 3 months. My daughter was only trying to set a timer and it died on her and won’t turn back on. There is no way to charge it and since we bought online I can’t return it now. Totally disappointing for my 6 year old. I’m completely unimpressed by a Garmin product!
customer_reviews.author: Jill L

customer_reviews.title: Not secure fit
customer_reviews.text: My daughter began wearing hers for her birthday at the end of June and this week (a little over two weeks of wearing it) the black piece that fits in the band came out while swimming and we were unable to find it. Several times it would slip out around the house and in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Schexnayder

customer_reviews.title: Child friendly tracker worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: 7 year old granddaughter wont be without it. Simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Brady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I got this for myself. I love the fact that you don’t have to charge it. It is accurate and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Alvina  sheikh

customer_reviews.title: Normally great, but missing component taints view
customer_reviews.text: We have had many Vivofits for our children, and have LOVED them. However, this particular one has been a bit disappointing. The product information says it came with an additional band. However, ours did not. My kid was pretty bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Blair

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I can’t finish the review because the watch was too small for my six year old very skinny thin wrist child :/
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: My girls love it and haven’t stopped using them. I think they see a little sensitive for tracking steps but the girls love them.
customer_reviews.author: Tressa H.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: My son has worn his for a day and the battery says it needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Love that you can set alarms for your kids to remind them to do things, like brush teeth or when it is time to read at night.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah M Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves it. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves the challenges and the step goals
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have this product since one month so I can’t say anything about battery life. My daughter is loving it. Very easy to use. Super fun and she can swim with it. Only “issue” is the design is already gone in the bracelet at some spot.
customer_reviews.author: lm

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 9 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Sleep tracking, tooth brush timer, games, keeping up with activity...she loves it all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cohagen

customer_reviews.title: Good for little kids
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my 5 year old. She now wakes up on her own. We set alarms to brush her hair and brush her teeth. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Kids today are exercise movement conscious!
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter wa excited to track her shoes like her sisters! She loves it! 🙏
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Garmin Vivofit Jr 2 with Two Stretchy Bands (Minnie Mouse & Black)
product_meta.description: The magic is all around when the Disney Minnie Mouse vívofit jr. 2 is on your kid's wrist. This swim-friendly activity tracker is tough enough to make it through playtime, and with 1+ year battery life, there's no stopping the action to recharge. Parents manage chores and rewards from the parent-controlled mobile app, while kids experience app adventures starring Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse and all their pals.Stylish and StrongTough and durable, vivofit jr. 2 features a customizable color screen and comfortable band. Your kid can show their Minnie Mouse style and rock it everywhere from recess to soccer, during bath time and even to bed. The user-replaceable battery will keep kicking for more than a year - no charging necessary.Advance in Mickey's Birthday Surprise: A Disney AdventureEvery day, kids unfold new adventures in the app as they reach their daily 60-minute activity goals, inspiring them to do their best. With you as their helper, your little character goes alongside Minnie Mouse and her friends in adventures as they plan a surprise birthday party for Mickey Mouse. Decorate for the party with Daisy Duck, whip up the birthday cake with Goofy, and get everything ready - but make sure Mickey Mouse doesn't find out!The Parental Personal AssistantParents use the free mobile app to manage the vivofit jr. 2 activity tracker. Parents can view activity, responsibilities, sleep and more after syncing with compatible Apple, Android and Amazon Fire Tablet devices. From...
feature_bullets: Garmin AUTHORIZED DEALER - Includes Full Garmin USA WARRANTY
[GARMIN VIVOFIT JR. 2]: Swim-friendly kids activity tracker with Disney Minnie Mouse

[COMFORTABLE & DURABLE]: Stretchy band comfortably fits a wrist 147 mm in circumference | Extra Black Stretchy Band In
[IN THE BOX]: Garmin vívofit jr. 2 Activity Tracker (Minnie Mouse band) | Limited 1-Year Warranty
